page.title: 10RECREATION IN CHITTERNE
page.content: Chitterne has a sportsfield with swings and a slide for children, and there are goal posts for football. It is also used for an annual gymkhana and fete organised and run locally. When there is snow several villagers have been observed out on their skiis, whilst others come out with their sledges and those who have neither use fertilizer bags, and much fun is had on the local slopes. Many people enjoy walking and riding, but access to M.O.D. land in the vicinity north of the village is restricted. A more unusual pastime is campanology and a few people ring the Church bells regularly in Chitterne and other nearby villages. Chitterne has five bells.
